intro: Eriocaulon wayanadense, commonly known as the Wayanad sedge, is a rare aquatic plant native to the wetlands of Kerala, India. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges, and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant typically grows in shallow, freshwater environments and has small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. It plays an important ecological role in maintaining the biodiversity of its habitat. Due to habitat loss and environmental changes, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
